NOTES: Around 1 January 2018 (beginning of month), local police raided four Sola Fide Congregation sites in Karamay City, Xinjiang and confiscated their blackboards, podiums, and donation boxes.

On 3 January 2018, government officials and about 100 personnel from the Demolitions and Evictions Headquarters of Furong District (Changsha, Hunan) arrived at the home of a veteran who had passed away 10 days ago from injuries sustained during clashes with a group of government personnel who tried to demolish his home. About a dozen personnel entered the home to take away his body by force while his son and daughter were restrained.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of China (2012-) People's Armed Police
NOTES: Property destruction: On 9 January 2018, dozens of government officials, excavation staff, special and riot police forces and People's Armed Police forces surrounded and used excavators and dynamite to demolish the Christian mega-church, Golden Lampstand Church, in Fushan County (Linfen, Shanxi). Some believers were also detained by the local authorities.

Arrests: On 14 January 2018, 20 Yinchuan City National Religious Affairs Bureau and Public Security Bureau officials and community personnel, went to the local Christian house church in Xingqing district (Yinchuan, Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region) and ordered them to stop religious activities, on the grounds that both the venue and the gatherings were illegal for not registering with government authorities. More than 30 believers were taken to the police station for interrogation. The church was asked to move away from the property as their landlord cancelled their rental agreement on the orders of public security officers.

Displacement: Around 16 January 2018 (month of), 221,000 Uyghur labourers were transferred from 22 counties in southern Xinjiang province (coded to Shuimogou, Urumqi) to regions of inner China, in a coercive labour transfer government program targeting groups of rural surplus labourers, emphasising the demographic of 'adults from low-income households' in 'minority regions'. The program reportedly involved components of militarisation and 'heavy-handed political indoctrination,' including 'gratitude to the party,' legal knowledge, Chinese language skills, work discipline and military drill.

On 18 January 2018, a group of police officers rushed into a Christian church in Zhengzhou, Henan. They accused the church of not having legal documents. Polices dispersed church members and closed down the church venue. Police also smashed up tables, speakers, and religious items in the church.

Around 31 January 2018 (end of month), 60 religion department government officials showed up at a house church in Zhengzhou, Henan and demolished it with chainsaws, confiscated Bibles and computers, before detained a handful of worshippers for 10 and more hours.
On 1 February 2018, when the new Religious Affairs Regulations came into effect, police in Henan began cracking down on Christian groups across 19 towns, including Zhengzhou, Shangqiu and Xinxiang.

On 2 February 2018, government authorities sent excavators to a Hui mosque in Manas county of Changji Hui Autonomous Prefecture, Xinjiang, demolishing the place of worship over 14 days. The mosque served over 1000 Muslims.

Around 4 February 2018 (between 1 - 8 February), the local Religious Affairs Bureau forcibly closed down more than 14 house churches in Huiji District (Zhengzhou, Henan). It was reported that two other house churches with more than 500 believers in another district of the same city were shut down during the same period. This was part of a campaign to suppress religious activities in Henan.

Around 13 February 2018 (between 6 - 20 February 2018), authorities in Guangdong ordered the closure and sealed off the meeting venue of a large Protestant Church in Futian District (Shenzhen, Guangdong). This was part of a broader campaign to crack down on Protestant churches which were not approved by the government.
On 17 February 2018, a church was sealed off and closed down by the authorities in Lashan village in Wafangdian City (Dalian City, Liaoning Province).

On 22 February 2018, the Shaxi Government removed the cross on top of a church in Shaxi Town (Shangrao, Jiangxi). During the process, more than 20 female followers attempted to stop the demolition. Previously, the government personnel demanded the church to take down the cross, but the church disagreed.

SOURCE: Union of Catholic Asian News; China Aid
NOTES: On 26 February 2018, the local government tore down two bell towers and statues, as well as the cross on the top of a Catholic church in Yining City (Ili, Xinjiang), and the religious symbols on the outer wall of the church were also painted over for the reason that the church was not in conformance of ''sinicization''.
On 1 March 2018, local police detained seven members of a Sola Fide Church in Korla City, Xinjiang and confiscated hundreds of thousands of RMB of donations.

On 2 March 2018, a Three-Self Church in Chengguan town, Yichuan county of Luoyang city, Henan was sealed off by workers from the local district government and soon closed down. The workers claimed that ''central authorities were coming in for an inspection'' even though the church had proper documentation in order.

On 2 March 2018, the local government of Xinyuan County closed down Xinyuan Uyghur Fourth Secondary School in Xinyuan County (Ili, Xinjiang) and transformed it into a ''political education centre'' which was used to detain Kazakhs in the region who were forced to receive ''political education''. The Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region Government had closed down the majority of schools for ethnic minorities in the region, and the campaign started from the beginning of March 2018.

On 7 March 2018, a Tibetan man committed self-immolation and died in Meruma Township in Ngawa County (Sichuan) in protest over Chinese Government's tightening control in Tibet, and to commemorate the anniversary of the March 10 Tibetan uprising in 1959.

Around 11 March 2018 (month of), on a Sunday, government authorities cracked down on private Christian meeting venues in a district (name not reported) in Henan, removing 700 religious banners, 200 religious texts and shutting down 31 illegal gathering places. Symbolic religious decorations and ornaments were also taken down door-to-door from the entrance of residential homes.

On 11 March 2018, the National People's Congress voted - only two voted against and three abstained out of 2,964 votes - and passed the constitutional amendments in the Great Hall of the People in Xicheng District (Beijing), including an amendment to abolish term limits for the country's president and vice-president, allowing them to remain in office indefinitely. China had previously imposed a two-term limit on its president since th 1990s.

On 12 March 2018, the Xiaotian Church, belonging to the officially sanctioned Protestant Three-Self Church, was sealed off by the police in Pulandian District (Dalian City, Liaoning Province). The police collected identity information of all who were present at the church.

On 12 March 2018, seven or eight police officers and personnel of the local Bureau of Religious Affairs forcibly closed down Jiamei house church in Urumqi (Xinjiang) and took several followers to the police station for interrogation. Four followers were later placed under administrative detention for ten days. The house church was accused of violating religious affairs regulations, and the religious gatherings were only allowed in the government-sanctioned churches.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), government authorities demanded a house church in Henan to take down religious objects - the cross, painting of The Last Supper, calligraphy of Bible verses - and demanded all church services to be stopped until the church and each worshipper was registered with the government.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), a 88-metre bronze statue of Shakyamuni (the historical Buddha) located in the Xiantang Mountain Scenic Area of Xiangyuan County (Changzhi City, Shanxi Province) was demolished on orders of the United Front Work Department and the State Administration of Religious Affairs. The statue was demolished on the grounds that it violated Article 30 of the new Regulation on Religious Affairs, which prohibits the construction of large outdoor religious statues.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), local police raided a Christian house church in Xinjiang and seized all Bibles, religious materials, and chairs. Three church leaders and four believers were also arrested and detained.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), an Islamic school in Lingwu City (Yinchuan City, Ningxia Province) was shut down by officials. It was reported that the officials also sent an excavator and threatened to demolish the school if they refused to shut down. This was part of a broader campaign by the Chinese government to crack down on religious freedom.

Around 16 March 2018 (week of), officials from the village committee, the United Front Work Department and the town religious management sealed off and shut down a Three-Self Church in Huaizhuang village, Yichuan county of Luoyang city, Henan.
Around 16 March 2018 (week of), the Nanshan Three-Self Church was sealed off and closed down by the authorities in Cuijiayao (Dalian City, Liaoning Province).

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), the auxiliary police went from home to home forcing the Uyghur residents to hand over all items with Muslim symbols in Xiahuanggong village (Ili Kazak Autonomous, Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region). It was part of a broader campaign by the Chinese government to crackdown on religious freedom.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), the National Security Bureau closed down an international school in Shenyang city, Liaoning for having religious affiliation, and deported three foreign school instructors for suspected religious activities.

On 17 March 2018, the director of local United Front Work Department brought a group of personnel to Huaizhuang Church at Yichuan County (Luoyang, Henan) to search for religious books and found five copies of Jinling Seminary Correspondence Coursebook as well as other theological materials. The director ordered the staff to confiscate and destroy all these books.
Arrests: On 17 March 2018, police forces from the prefecture, county, and town levels arrested 27 Muslim women during an early morning raid in Manas county of Changji, Xinjiang for illegal assembly.

On 21 March 2018, the local Bureau of Religious Affairs, Yunyang Sub-District Office, Dongfanghong Police Station, and Chengjiaxiang Sub-District Office forcibly closed down the Yueliangwan house church in Gao'an City (Yichun, Jiangxi) during a gathering of the house church for the reason that the house church did not register at the local Bureau of Religious Affairs.

On 22 March 2018, a house church established by Koreans in Chuxiong City (Chuxiong Yi Autonomous, Yunnan) was shut down by the police and government officials, on the grounds that ''the church was not registered, and the meeting place is illegal''. On the day of the raid, more than 100 police officers were mobilised, and the pastor, elder, and seven deacons of the church were arrested.

Around 23 March 2018 (between 22-24 March 2018), officials sealed off and shut down the Three-Self churches in Guo and Lizhai villages of Yichuan county of Luoyang city, Henan. They threatened to tear down the church in Lizhai if anyone tried to remove the seal, and ordered congregations to be stopped when worshippers continued to assemble outside.
Arrests: On 30 March 2018, 29 Christian house church members were arrested by authorities in Jiangsu, then detained for five to ten days at the Pizhou Detention Center.

Around 31 March 2018 (end of month), the Qigu Buddhist Temple in Xinmi City (Zhengzhou, Henan) was closed down and sealed by the local authority as the new Regulations on Religious Affairs came into effect in the beginning of 2018.

Around 31 March 2018 (end of month), the Bureau of Religious Affairs and the United Front Work Department forcibly closed down a more than a thousand-year-old Luohan Temple in Jiajinkou Town (Zhengzhou City, Henan Province) for the reason that it was an ''unpermitted temple''. The temple was built more than 1,600 years ago during the Eastern Jin Dynasty. This was part of a broader campaign to close down Buddhist Temples in Henan.

Around 31 March 2018 (end of month), 56 Islamic architectural symbols were dismantled from several residential building rooftops by workers in cranes in the Luhuazhou community of Xixia district of Yinchuan city, Ningxia. The act was reportedly part of a government-led demolition effort.

SOURCE: Union of Catholic Asian News; China Aid
NOTES: On 1 April 2018, the local authorities confiscated the properties which belonged to two churches where two underground Catholic priests served in the Catholic Diocese of Luoyang (Henan), forcibly evicted two priests, and forbade them to hold religious gatherings in churches. It was a part of a governmental campaign to crack down on underground religious institutions in Henan Province.
Around 1 April 2018 (week of), the subordinate meeting places of Tianjia Three-Self Church were sealed off and closed down by the authorities in Wafangdian City (Dalian City, Liaoning Province).

On 1 April 2018, the house of a petitioner-cum-forced-evictee was forcibly demolished in Taohe village, Weiji town of Suining county (Xuzhou, Jiangsu) (location coded at Weiji town). The man had been targeted by demolition authorities and police forces since reporting the Taohe Village Party Secretary for corruption twice in 2016. In February 2018, the local government intimidated him into never petitioning again, and forced him to sign a demolition and relocation agreement. This was his second property demolition without compensation.

On 1 April 2018, dozens of police officers broke into a Catholic church in Nanluo Village, Huiguo Town (Gongyi, Zhengzhou, Henan) and confiscated 6 to 7 big bundles of religious books, as well as furniture, computers, and stereo equipment. They also cut off the church's power supply and sealed it off. It was also reported that police tried to arrest the priest of the church earlier in the same morning, but the priest escaped. Over the next two days, police went back to the church trying to arrest the priest and also warned local people that nobody was allowed to enter the church. The police returned on 21 April 2018 to confiscate the remaining items in the church.

Property destruction: On 6 April 2018, police forces of China demolished a petitioner's house in Cigou Village, Xuchang City, Henan Province. In the past, the petitioner had been both under administrative arrests and criminal arrests. She had been accused of ''damage the government's image'' and was suspected of ''provoking trouble'' by posting her whereabouts on the internet.

Around 9 April 2018 (month of), on a Sunday, government authorities razed a Protestant Three-Self church in Luohe, Henan to the ground, and cited planning and reconstruction as the reason for taking down the legal, pre-approved, government-controlled structure. Church members and co-workers who learnt about the sudden decision arrived at the scene, but police forces confined them to the car and confiscated their phones until the demolition was completed at 6am the next day.

On 10 April 2018, four mosques in two villages of Shawan County (Tarbagatay Prefecture, Xinjiang Province) were razed to the ground. This was one of a series of events to crack down on religious activities of Muslims in the county.

On 10 April 2018, government authorities shut down a prominent temple in Golog, Qinghai, prohibiting tourists and pilgrims from visiting, and Tibetans from conducting ceremonies, worship and other Buddhist activities. Local Tibetans supported the closure of the temple for peace and conservation reasons, but disagreed with the banning of religious activities.

On 11 April 2018, 5 men using angle grinders sawed off the cross of a Three-Self Church in Nanhua community of Minquan District (Shangqiu City, Henan Province). They told the church director that anyone who continued their belief would be arrested.

On 12 April 2018, authorities turned up at a government-controlled Three-Self Denglongba Church in Lushui, Yunnan and demolished it after a three-day notice from the Bureau of Religious Affairs cancelling its certification. Under the ''Lushui City Religious Activities Sites Consolidation Program,'' the church was told to merge its congregation with another church in the city - Christian Two Meetings' Center Church. Three-Self churches are typically approved by the government and this one cost nearly 500,000 RMB member fees to build.
Around 15 April 2018 (month of), a mosque in Shihezi, Xinjiang was shut down by the local authorities and its imam was taken into custody at an unknown location.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), a house church in Qinhuangdao (Hebei) was closed down by the local authorities after its preacher shared some video footages about government's persecution of religion and refused to sign a guarantee offered by the local authority that she would not share the gospel anymore.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), the chief of a local police station led 5 policemen and ransacked a Three-Self church in Ledu District (Haidong City, Qinghai Province). The police confiscated all Bibles and broke into a donations box, taking over 1,000 RMB. They also destroyed crosses, flowers, balloons, and other decorations in the room. 1 church member was arrested.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), a mosque in Pingluo County (Shizuishan City, Ningxia Province) was forced to shut down its Islamic classes by the government, as part of a broader campaign by the Chinese government to crack down on religious freedom.
Around 15 April 2018 (month of), a mosque in Yuli County (Bayingolin Mongolia Autonomous, Xinjiang Province) was completely levelled by the police, with all of its bricks and wood cleared away.
Around 15 April 2018 (month of), officials removed the cross of a Three-Self Church in Gongyi City (Zhengzhou, Henan). This was part of a broader campaign to remove crosses on churches across China.

On 15 April 2018, three to four plainclothes police officers broke into a house church meeting venue in Bengbu City, Anhui Province, where one of the police officers confiscated money from the offering box and all the money the believers had believed with them. It was also reported that all copies of the Bible found at the venue were confiscated. More than 10 believers from the church were arrested on the same day, on the grounds that their church was not under the state-approved Three-Self church.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), government personnel demolished the upper dome, minaret, crescent moon, and a large plaque of Wujiawan Grand Mosque in Baofeng town (Shizuishan, Ningxia), on the grounds that the mosque was not reconstructed according to the state-prescribed official rules. They then replaced these symbols with the national flag. This was carried out under the new Regulation on Religious Affairs to ''Sinicize'' religious venues in the region.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), government authorities shut down the Zaoyuan Arabic Translation Training Base and Islamic Scripture Institute in Wuzhong city, Ningxia as part of an effort to prevent Arabic from becoming a minority language in China. The centre was important to the Hui Muslims in the region, and 700 enrolled students and 30 teachers were impacted by the closure.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), the local government removed the cross from the Shanchuan Church in Beishankou town (Zhengzhou City, Henan Province) and printed the name of the church in red. The slogan ''National law trumps religious law'' was written on the exterior wall. This was part of a broader campaign to remove crosses on churches across China.

Around 15 April 2018 (between 10 - 20 April), the Bureau of Religious Affairs in Zoucheng closed down five gathering venues of Christian house churches in Zoucheng City (Jining, Shangdong). It was part of an operation against ''anti-pornographic and anti-illegal activities'' launched by the authorities in the city where more than 1,100 ''illegal religious publications and CDs'' were seized.

On 16 April 2018, a Christian church in Yucheng County (Shangqiu City, Henan Province) was demolished by the township government, on the grounds that they were ''building a cultural square''. This was part of a broader campaign to crack down on places of worship across China.

On 16 April 2018, a dozen of armed regular and auxiliary police officers and government workers using excavators and front loaders demolished a Protestant church in Beixinxing Village (Xinxiang City, Henan Province) claiming that the church building was illegal. Members of the congregation were at the site to observe under the police's supervision.

SOURCE: Union of Catholic Asian News; China Aid
NOTES: On 17 April 2018, it was reported that Public Security officers, village and county governments, raided a Catholic church in Xin Village (Linzhou, Anyang, Henan) and took away the church's sacred object as a part of a coordinated action against ''underground'' Catholic churches conducted across Henan province in April 2018. It was also reported that many Christian house churches in a village in Linzhou City were raided by village officials on the same day, where the officials forcibly removed religious couplets, and took away portraits of Jesus and religious calendars. This was part of a broader campaign launched by the town government to disrupt Christian religious activities.

SOURCE: China Aid; Union of Catholic Asian News
NOTES: On 17 April 2018, the local government tore down a church connected to the residence of an underground Catholic priest in Hutuo Village (Zhengzhou, Henan) in Catholic Diocese of Luoyang, forcibly evicted the priest, and destroyed the tombstone of the late bishop for the second time. It was a part of a governmental campaign to crack down on underground religious institutions in Henan Province.

SOURCE: Union of Catholic Asian News; China Aid
NOTES: On 17 April 2018, the local authority closed down a gathering venue set up by Catholic ''Tong Chou Hui'' of Mingonglu Catholic Church on Jiefang Road in Erqi District (Zhengzhou, Henan) and banned future gatherings at the venue. In the same Catholic Diocese of Zhengzhou, the local authorities also confiscated the religious books in Shuanghuaishu Catholic Church, Jiayu Catholic Church, and Youfangcun Church, and searched through the ledgers of Mingonglu Catholic Church and the Xiaodelan Nursing House for the Elderly, which were run by the church. It was a part of a governmental campaign to crack down on underground religious institutions in Henan Province.

SOURCE: Union of Catholic Asian News; China Aid
NOTES: Around 17 April 2018 (as reported), the local authorities closed down a Catholic kindergarten in Anyang (Henan) which belonged to the Catholic Diocese of Anyang, and the children in the kindergarten were required by the teachers to report their parents' religious belief, and the parents were required to register in the kindergarten. It was a part of a governmental campaign to crack down the underground religious institutions in Henan Province.

SOURCE: Union of Catholic Asian News; China Aid
NOTES: On 17 April 2018, the local authorities confiscated religious objects during a raid on Gaoqiangyintang Catholic Church in Hua County (Anyang, Henan) in Catholic Diocese of Anyang. They also forcibly evicted the staffs, and forbade the renovation of the built houses of the church. It was a part of a governmental campaign to crack down the underground religious institutions in Henan Province.

SOURCE: China Aid; Union of Catholic Asian News
NOTES: Around 17 April 2018 (as reported), the local authorities tore down Catholic churches in the Catholic Diocese of Puyang in Puyang City (Henan). It was a part of a governmental campaign to crack down the underground religious institutions in Henan Province.

On 17 April 2018, more than 100 police officers with over 30 police cars deployed by the Gongyi Religious Affairs Bureau and Public Security Bureau used large bulldozers to demolish a Catholic church in Gongyi City (Zhengzhou City, Henan Province), claiming that the church building was illegal. The police put up a cordon to block off the scene and prohibit people from entering or taking pictures.

On 17 April 2018, local government demolished a mosque in Laoshawan Town (Ili, Xinjiang) and destroyed, burned, and buried everything. Afterwards, the authorities reconstructed shops on the original site of the mosque.

On 17 April 2018, the government confiscated the finances of the Church of Beixishang Village (Jiaozuo, Henan) and ordered the church to demolish its cross. This event was reported as a part of a coordinated action against ''underground'' Catholic churches conducted across Henan province in April 2018.

On 19 April 2018, the church of Hutuo Village in Gongyi City (Zhengzhou, Henan) was demolished by the authority as a part of a coordinated action against ''underground'' Catholic churches conducted across Henan province in April 2018.

On 20 April 2018, the cross of a Christian church in Wangyoufang, Huangkou township (Shangqiu City, Henan Province) was demolished by the local authorities. Officials from the township government and city government came to oversee the removal of the cross on the day of demolition. Government workers also went into the church and smashed the church cross sign. This was part of a broader campaign by the CCP to remove crosses and other religious symbols from churches.

On 20 April 2018, local police raided a Sola Fide gathering place located in Huaihua, Hunan, confiscating all the properties and money in the donation box that can be taken away inside the church and smashed everything else. One of the Christians was also arrested during the raid for questioning the motives of the police.

On 21 April 2018, the Gongyi Religious Affairs Bureau closed down and locked up the Jinding and Zushi Temples in Caigou Village of Heluo Town (Zhengzhou City, Henan Province) for the reason that they were ''unpermitted''. This was part of a broader campaign to close down Buddhist Temples in Henan.

Arrests: On 21 April 2018, 80 Hui Chinese Muslim villagers were arrested by the police during a raid in Ergong village of Shihezi, Xinjiang, and detained in the Shihezi 145th Regiment Drug Rehabilitation Centre for a planned duration of three to five years. Authorities arrested over 100 across two consecutive days, then sealed off the roads to Ergong and implemented entry restrictions.
On 23 April 2018, government authorities shut down a Three-Self church in Qucun township of Puyang (Henan), and covered all faith-related signage visible at its entrance.

SOURCE: China Aid; Union of Catholic Asian News
NOTES: On 24 April 2018, the local government closed down the Gedazhang Catholic Church in Dangdian Town (Zhumadian, Henan) in the Catholic Diocese of Zhumadian for the reason that the church was not registered in the local government. However, the priest of the church intended to register the church, but the local government did not allow the registration and the opening of the church.

On 24 April 2018, a private memorial hall in Chendong Village (Luohe, Henan) built by local people and dedicated to Chairman Mao and other Generals that played major roles in establishing the Chinese People's Republic was destroyed by unidentified men. Statues were smashed and photos were taken off the walls. Social media comments suggested that the incident was likely backed by powerful political figures in the current Chinese leadership. There was no official response from the government.
On 25 April 2018, local authorities began to demolish a mosque located in Shanghudi Town (Ili, Xinjiang). The demolition lasted for 5 days.

Around 30 April 2018 (end of month), a school ran by a house church in Xiamen City, Fujian Province was forcibly closed by local officials, on the grounds that unregistered places of worship could not run education institutions as it was against China's religious management regulations.

On 30 April 2018, government officials shut down a Three-Self Movement-affiliated church in Yongcheng county (Shangqiu, Henan), dismantled the cross and tore down portraits of Christ. They claimed the church was too close to a school, and shut it down after learning that gatherings were still being held despite government efforts block off the area.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of China (2012-) Xinjiang Production and Construction Corps
NOTES: Property destruction: Around 1 May 2018 (beginning of month), local authorities forcibly demolished and rebuilt the mosque in the Xinjiang Production and Construction Corps, Shihezi General Field, 6th Branch, 14th Company [location coded as Hongshan], because it ''used Arabic characters''. The rebuilt mosque had no identifying symbols and had surveillance cameras installed at its entrances.

Around 1 May 2018 (beginning of month), the local government forcibly demolished a Christian nursing home in Shuichun Town (Shanwei, Guangdong) for the reason that it was an unapproved construction project which was not registered. The nursing home belonged to Baishitang Christian Church and was used for the weekly gathering of the church followers, and the Shanwei government deployed two to three police officers to demolish the nursing home.
On 5 May 2018, the local government tore down the cross of a Christian Church in Yichuan County (Luoyang, Henan). It was a part of a governmental campaign in Henan to suppress religious belief.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Christian Group (China); Civilians (South Korea); Christian Group (South Korea)
NOTES: On 6 May 2018, eight police officers seized mobile phones, computers and notebooks found in an apartment in Heze city, Shandong where 13 Christians - among which were four South Korean missionaries - were having a religious gathering. They were tracked down via mobile phone GPS positioning. All of them were first detained, before the four missionaries were deported back to South Korea and the rest taken into custody.

On 6 May 2018, village authorities shut down and demolished a state-sanctioned Three-Self Church in Zaomushan village, Fengyi county of Xinyu with less than a day's notice. Almost a hundred church members were affected. The alleged reason for the act was that the church was an ''eyesore'' located near the tomb of Xi Zaochi, a historical figure of whom President Xi Jinping is a 55th generation descendant.

On 10 May 2018, the local government tore down the cross from the Christ Gonghui Church in Beishankou town (Zhengzhou City, Henan Province). This was part of a broader campaign to remove crosses on churches across China.

On 10 May 2018, the leader of the Pingtan County Urban Construction Office brought a group of people to tear apart the middle section of the remodelled shipping containers used as a gathering venue by a Three-Self Church in Aoqian town (Fuzhou City, Fujian Province). A week later, 20 workers from the Longtian Town Urban Construction Office returned to the site to completely tore down the containers on the grounds that it was an ''illegal structure''. It was reported that the local government had first tried to demolish the worship place on 17 April 2018.
On 10 May 2018, 3 police officers raided a house church in Qingyunpu Town (Nanchang, Jiangxi), taking away all the money and interrogating the church supervisor about the church's gathering.

On 11 May 2018, the police arrested a couple in Nanjing (Jiangsu) who worshipped The Church of Almighty God. Goods belonging to the Church, valued at 1,213,000 RMB total, and other personal valuables were seized from their homes.

On 11 May 2018, the local government tore down the cross from the Gospel Church in Beishankou town (Zhengzhou City, Henan Province), on the grounds that ''Chinese churches cannot be like foreign churches, therefore, cannot use the cross as a symbol''. The words ''Gospel Church'' on the plaque were also removed. This was part of a broader campaign to remove crosses on churches across China.

On 12 May 2018, the police apprehended two believers from the Church of Almighty God (a couple) from Jiangning district (Nanjing, Jiangsu). They seized goods that belonged to the Church amounting to 213,000 RMB.

Around 13 May 2018 (week of), authorities brought down and targeted one Three-Self Church in Zhongyuan village in Xinyu City, Jiangxi Province, citing the ''3 Renovations 1 Demolition'' movement as justification.

On 13 May 2018, the police arrested a church leader and another worshipper belonging to The Church of Almighty God in Taixing city (Taizhou, Jiangsu). Church money and personal valuables were confiscated during a house raid.

On 13 May 2018, the local government seized a Three-Self Church in Nanhua community of Minquan District (Shangqiu City, Henan Province). The local government posted a sign on the roof of the church that read ''Nanhua Community Party Service Center'' and replaced the cross with a party emblem. The church became an office of the Chuwa Village Committee.
Around 15 May 2018 (month of), local authorities shut down a Catholic church venue in Baisi Town (Hebi, Henan).
Around 15 May 2018 (month of), local authorities shut down a village Catholic church in Ruzhou City (Pingdingshan City, Henan Province).

Around 16 May 2018 (month of), municipal authorities of religious affairs and public security shut down the Good News Church in Qingdao city, Shandong and destroyed the venue after they sent a notice ordering for gatherings to be stopped, and for the administration to apply for a government license to join the state-sanctioned Three-Self Movement. More than 70 Christian believers had to seek other churches that would accommodate their hearing impairment.

Around 16 May 2018 (month of), the local government forcibly removed the cross of a government-approved Three-Self Gospel Church located in a town of Yugan County (Shangrao, Jiangxi). It was reported that the local government had threatened to withhold five million RMB of appropriation for village construction to coerce the local villagers into dismantling the cross.

Around 16 May 2018 (month of), government authorities whitewashed and sawed off crosses in six state-sanctioned churches in six various villages around Yushu city (Changchun, Jilin) before finally shutting them down.

Around 16 May 2018 (month of), village government officials tore down parts of a wall surrounding a church congregation site in Hexia town (Xinyu, Jiangxi) to repurpose it with the village committee assembly hall next doors.

Around 16 May 2018 (month of), the Buddhist Guanying Ancient Temple in Liangzihu District (Ezhou city, Hubei) was converted into a cultural activity centre by the local government referring to the CCP's policy banning the construction of temples. There was no compensation made to the donors. The owner of the temple and some believers that went on to petitions were detained by the police for 'disrupting social order'.

On 17 May 2018, three police officers raided a house church in Qingshanhu District (Nanchang, Jiangxi) and took away all the donation money. They also incited the neighbours to report any religious gatherings and shut down the house church.

On 17 May 2018, the local government removed the cross of Xiaobet Church in Gongyi City (Zhengzhou City, Henan Province). This was part of a broader campaign to remove crosses on churches across China.

Arrests: Around 18 May 2018 (between 11 - 25 May 2018), the Shanxi Provincial Public Security Department launched an operation to ''combat religions'' in Shanxi. By employing tactics for eliminating gang crime to crackdown on religious groups, they arrested at least 1500 people within the first two weeks. It was reported that authorities had discussed tactics to target members of Islamic and Christian movements such as the Shouters, The Church of Almighty God, and Falun Gong during a meeting related to the operation.
Around 20 May 2018 (week of), authorities demolished a Three-Self Church in Zhentian village in Xinyu City, Jiangxi Province, citing the ''3 Renovations 1 Demolition'' movement as justification.
On 25 May 2018, a government-approved Catholic church was shut down in Liushanhu Town (Xianning, Hubei) by the local authorities.

On 25 May 2018, government employees removed the cross from the Taoyuan Church in Shecun town (Zhengzhou City, Henan Province), citing that all church crosses had been taken down in Gongyi and Xingyang Cities. This was part of a broader campaign to remove crosses on churches across China.

On 27 May 2018, more than 40 Special Police, along with officials from the local Religious Affairs Department and officials from the Residential District Office, closed a protestant church in Lanzhou City, Gansu Province on the ground of ''setting up religious venues and organising religious activities without permission''. The police arrested 7 church leaders and released them on the same day. The police also carried away the church offering box, the lectern and other items. It was reported that a total of 5 significant churches in Lanzhou City were closed by the authorities since February, affecting around 700 church members.

On 28 May 2018, the Xiacheng District Government sold a 1500-square-meters land owned by the Catholic Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception in Xiacheng District (Hangzhou City, Zhejiang City) and the police forcibly sealed off the land in the early morning on the day before. Some church members hung a banner that read ''no occupying religious property'' outside the church.

Around 1 June 2018 (beginning of month), over 30 personnel from the local National Security Division, Ethnic and Religious Affairs Bureau, and other government institutions raided the ''Home of Christ'' fellowship at Shantou University in Jinping District (Shantou City, Guangdong Province). They confiscated over 5,000 books, including 200 Bibles, amounting to over RMB 100,000. The ''Home of Christ'' attempted to negotiate with the authorities to reclaim the books, but the officials stated that the publications were ''illegal'' and they would be burnt if the fellowship insisted on claiming them back.

On 2 June 2018, police charged into the home of an elderly member of the Church of Almighty God in Tongshan District (Xuzhou, Jiangsu) to arrest her and two other adherents. Police confiscated about a dozen religious books during the arrest and then ransacked one of the other adherent's home, seizing digital devices and religious texts. The elderly woman was released due to her poor health, but the other two adherents were held in an unknown location. This is part of a province-wide crackdown on the new Christian movement.

SOURCE: Union of Catholic Asian News; Bitter Winter
NOTES: On 5 June 2018, the government authorities demolished a Roman Catholic Way of the Cross at the Our Lady of Mount Carmel pilgrimage site in Tianjiajing Village (Anyang City, Henan Province). Officials removed images of Jesus at the site.

SOURCE: China Aid; Union of Catholic Asian News
NOTES: On 5 June 2018, people hired by the local government demolished 14 Stations of the Cross along the paths of Shengmu Mountain, a Catholic Christian holy mountain in the Catholic Diocese of Anyang, in Yuankang Town (Anyang, Henan) with excavators and pickup trucks. One month ago, the government personnel from the Henan Provincial Government tried to convince the Bishop of the Anyang Diocese to take down the Stations of the Cross.

Property destruction: On 11 June 2018, a government-controlled Three-Self church was demolished in Shuangmiao of Taohe village, Xichuan county of Nanyang, Henan by police and township authorities, claiming that the church was a source of water pollution.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of China (2012-) People's Armed Police
NOTES: Property destruction: On 13 June 2018, armed policemen and government authorities tore down a church nearing completion in Huangzhuyuan village (Jizhong town, Dancheng County), Zhoukou city of Henan. The main church building was completely taken down after two days.

Around 15 June 2018 (month of), the local police destroyed and confiscated objects like an umbrella stand, several refrigerators, a display cupboard and food items from a Muslim shop in Jiaozuo city (Henan). The shop belonged to a Muslim couple, and the husband was arrested by the state for guilt by association with his ''terrorist'' brother.
Around 15 June 2018 (month of), local authorities forcibly shut down a Sola Fide church with over 100 believers in Changchun, Jilin.

Around 15 June 2018 (middle of month), a 29-meter-tall carving of Shakyamuni Buddha on a Mountain in Fengman district (Jilin, Jilin) was destroyed by the local authorities. The demolition is suspected to be a part of religious suppression of Buddhism in China.

Around 15 June 2018 (month of), several local government officials forced an ongoing session of a church congregation located at Yuanjiang County (Yuxi, Yunnan) to stop, forcing participants out of the venue and sealed it off. Several members were also taken away for interrogation.
Around 15 June 2018 (month of), local authorities sealed off a temple in Huangshi City, Hubei Province. The abbot of the temple was forced to become homeless.
Around 15 June 2018 (month of), local authorities forcibly shut down three Sola Fide churches in Baishan City, Jilin Province.

Around 15 June 2018 (month of), government officials demolished a congregation site of a house church in Luofang town (Xinyu, Jiangxi) after deceiving church members to go out on a trip to register with the Three-Self Church.

Around 15 June 2018 (month of), the Wanshou Palace, a thousand-year-old Taoist temple, was shut down in Xiuyan Manchu Autonomous County (Liaoning). Despite prior approval by the China Taoist Association and the Religious Affairs Bureau, CCP authorities claimed that the Palace did not have a religious activity venue registration certificate. Monks were expelled.
Around 15 June 2018 (month of), authorities shut down and targeted a Huatian Three-Self church and a Shabei church in Xinyu city, Jiangxi.
Around 15 June 2018 (month of), local CCP cadres seized a church congregation located in a village of Fuzhou, Jiangxi and turned it into an office of the village party committee.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Buddhist Group (China); Christian Group (China); Muslim Group (China)
NOTES: Around 15 June 2018 (month of), the CCP launched a new nationwide ''four requirements'' campaign to promote the ''sinicisation'' of religion. Under the campaign, religious communities must adopt four specific practices: ritually raising the national flag while singing the national anthem; teaching believes about, and promoting, the Chinese Constitution, laws, and regulations; preaching and promoting the ''Core Socialist Values''; and promoting China's traditional culture. This campaign has led to crackdown on religious communities in various provinces.

Arrests: Around 16 June 2018 (week of), more than 100 Uyghurs were arrested in Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region because they shared festival messages through digital devices during the Muslim festival, Eid al Fitr (festival of breaking the fast).
On 20 June 2018, more than 20 police officers raided the home of a couple who were members of The Church of Almighty God. They searched the house and confiscated 400,000 RMB worth of church assets.

On 25 June 2018, the Henan provincial government started demolishing a government-controlled Three-Self church in Dahuangye village in Gongyi city (Zhengzhou, Henan) on the grounds that it was ''occupying a planning area intended for the constructing of a tourist site.'' The demolition went on for several days.

Arrests: Arrests: On 25 June 2018, 64 members of The Church of Almighty God (CAG) were arrested in Suzhou, Jiangsu. They were part of at least 350 CAG members that have been arrested in Jiangsu Province since a national campaign against the CAG began in April 2018.
On 25 June 2018, the police arrested a couple in Zhangjiagang (Suzhou, Jiangsu) who worshipped The Church of Almighty God, taking 400,000 RMB in cash and bank savings.

Arrests: Around 27 June 2018 (between 26-28 June 2018), more than 700 believers of The Church of Almighty God were mass arrested by public security forces across Liaoning province. Known as ''Operation Thunder,'' nearly 300 people were arrested in Dalian and Panjin, 47 in Dandong, 39 in Chaoyang, 36 in Benxi, 23 in Jinzhou, 19 in Shenyang, 14 in Fuxin, 9 in Fushun, 8 in Huludao, 5 in Yingkou, 2 in Tieling and 1 in Anshan prefecture-cities. At the time, The Church of Almighty God was reported to be the most severely persecuted house church in China.

On 27 June 2018, seven police officers broke into the homes of two female worshippers of The Church of Almighty God in Huanren Manchu Autonomous County of Liaoning province, seizing religious books, optical disks and an MP3 player, and arrested them both without the presentation of any warrant. More were arrested across cities and districts of Liaoning that day.
Around 27 June 2018 (week of), the Land and Resources Bureau in Qingfeng county, Henan seized the building of Three-Self Church and ordered its worshippers to pay a fine of 5,406 RMB.

Around 27 June 2018 (week of), government authorities demolished a Buddhist temple in Suijiang county, Yunnan because it ''affected the village's appearance.'' The act was performed without prior notice to local residents or worshippers.
On 27 June 2018, local authorities assembled over 200 personnel and demolished a Buddhist temple in Jicheng Town (Zhengzhou, Henan).

On 5 July 2018, a group of unidentified people hired by the local authority locked down the door of Beijing Xi'an House Church's gathering venue in Yizhuang Town (Daxing, Beijing) and the door in the hallway to the venue, guarded outside the door for at least three consecutive days and forbade people to enter, and blocked all stairs to the gathering venue on the third floor. Previously, the Xi'an House Church was harassed and threatened by the local authority for the reason that the church refused to install CCTV, and the church was also informed that the rental contract for their church was not to be continued.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of China (2012-) People's Armed Police
NOTES: On 8 July 2018, armed police ordered raids and shutdowns of several house churches across Liaoning, including a Justification by Faith house church in Wulongbei town of Dandong city, and three small churches in Majiagang village and Huangtukan township of Donggang city, and Xinglongshan (of Anshan city) respectively. As of 19 Aug, there had been at least 40 closures and persecutions of house churches in Liaoning since the issue of ''Two Special Tasks Notifications from the State Administration of Religious Affairs of the PRC'' on 15 March.

On 10 July 2018, as many as 200 Buddhist novices (under the age of 16) were evicted from Sershul monastery in Sershul county of Garze Tibetan Autonomous Region to be enrolled into a secular school run by the Chinese government. If they resisted, the monastery faced closure and punishment. The Sershul monastery is both a prominent Gelugpa centre and the only Buddhist monastic university in the Kham region.

On 10 July 2018, Unirule Institute of Economics, an independent, liberal think tank considered to be the ''last bastion for liberal thought'', was shuttered in Beijing city for unspecific reasons, and five members of staff were trapped for an hour after men welded their office entrance shut at the request of the property owner.

On 12 July 2018, properties set up by Tibetans around the Qinghai Lake (Hainan Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture) underwent mass demolition by government authorities for alleged environmental protection purposes. These included restaurants, shops and guesthouses set up for seasonal tourism, as well as private residences. The demolishment has been going on until at least 1 August 2018, with a 2-day paus in between. This had happened the year before in the same region and nearby villages, affecting Muslim and Han Chinese property owners indiscriminately.

On 13 July 2018, local authorities raided ''Prayer Mountain'' in Ningjiang district of Songyuan city, Jilin. It was an eight-story residential building for church members adjoining a two-story house church, which was reduced to ruins in the morning of 14 July. The police took away all the money and assets they found in rooms belonging to its 330 residents, and confiscated a number of cars. It was reported on 9 August that authorities would be demolishing the building out of concerns for earthquake safety - despite its excellent seismic rating deemed by experts.

Arrests: On 13 July 2018, 330 church members were apprehended by the police in Ningjiang district of Songyuan, Jilin. They attended the same church and lived in the same residential complex - all were subsequently sent to Shanyou Middle School for forced ''re-education,'' except for the principal church workers, who were sent to the detention centre in Shanyou. Local authorities claim that only 220 were arrested.

On 15 July 2018, public security personnel pressured a family church at Xingang community of Xinyu city, Jiangxi into taking down the Cross, and forbade underaged citizens from entering church areas. This is part of a city-wide effort in Xinyu to ask family churches to take down Christian symbols and replace them with the national flag and portraits of President Xi.

Property destruction: Around 16 July 2018 (month of), a temple in Taiyi Town, Chang'an District (Xi'an, Shaanxi) was demolished by 50 to 60 people, including personnel from the Chang'an district's Judicial Bureau, Public Security Bureau, Traffic Police Brigade, and local security guards. The temple was destroyed on the basis that it did not have a permit.
Around 16 July 2018 (month of), government officials shut down a church in Luosha village of Huze town (Xinyu, Jiangxi), and purchased the church for village meetings.

Around 16 July 2018 (month of), government officials demolished a congregation site of Tangxia house church in Zhentian village of Shuixi town (Xinyu, Jiangxi) after opposing their belief in a ''Westerners' God.''

Around 16 July 2018 (month of), authorities of Dengfeng, Henan launched a massive campaign to destroy Buddhist and Daoist sites in Zhongling Mountain Scenic Area, Yingyang Town (Zhengzhou, Henan). 22,000 square meters of building were demolished, 25 retail stores selling religious goods were destroyed, and three individuals were detained during the campaign.
Around 16 July 2018 (month of), officials removed electronics and seized furniture, stereos and pianos from the Xiashanqiao Three-Self Church in Luofang town (Xinyu, Jiangxi).

Around 16 July 2018 (month of), a Christian welfare home for children was shut down in Xinmi city, Henan after authorities claimed that ''foreign entities [are using] religion as a means of infiltration.'' 50 orphans were sent to a welfare centre in Yuanzhuang township.

Around 16 July 2018 (month of), local officials demolished a Buddhist temple in Xianning City, Hubei Province. It was reported that the caretaker of the temple continued to live in secret at the site of the temple.

Around 16 July 2018 (month of), the police shut down shops belonging to ten Han Chinese households in Changji city, Xinjiang and detained them after they arrived minutes late to the training meeting of the ''ten household joint defense'' counterrorism program. Under the program, Han Chinese joint-defense households were distributed riot control gear and a red armband by the police, expected to be on the lookout for Uyghur-identifying individuals and to rush to a meeting site when an alarm sounds.
Around 16 July 2018 (month of), local officials demolished a Buddhist temple in Jingzhou City, Hubei Province.

SOURCE: Union of Catholic Asian News; China Aid
NOTES: On 17 July 2018, around 70 people sent by the local government demolished Liangwang Catholic Church in Jinan Catholic Diocese in Liangwang Village (Jinan, Shandong) (event coded at Jinan City) for the reason that the church was within the area for the new real estate development planned by the local government. Three female followers of the church were on duty that day and forcibly taken out from the church by the people who demolished the church, and had their phones were confiscated. All properties of the church were buried under the ruin. Earlier in the year, the Shilihe Catholic Church in the same diocese was also demolished by the local authority.

Arrests: On 18 July 2018, eight police officers arrested 12 adults and 28 middle and high school students in the remote forests of Langzhong city, Sichuan after shutting down a Christian summer camp organized by a Justification by Faith church. As of 20 Aug, all were released except for a pastor who continued to be in custody.

On 26 July 2018, a man from Tongliao prefecture, Inner Mongolia set off a ''firecracker-like explosive'' outside the Embassy of the United States in Chaoyang District (Beijing). The explosive device was described as a (small, low-grade) bomb by some non-Chinese media sources like CNN and The Guardian. It was reported that the man had originally intended to throw the explosive into the building, but it detonated next to him instead, injuring his hand and damaging a few cars nearby. The police took the man to the hospital and conducted further investigation. Police did not identify a motive, and no one else was injured.

Arrests: Around 27 July 2018 (between 24-31 July 2018), Chinese authorities arrested over 200 Church of Almighty God members in Linfen city during the launch of a massive arrest operation, codename ''Operation Fox,'' across all of Shanxi province. Sixty members were captured in Huozhou district, and over 50 in the Caocun mining district. Without relying on any connectivity to electronic devices or communication networks, authorities tracked their targets' movement with a satellite position system that measured thermal energy from human body heat.

On 29 July 2018, seven police officers raided a sola fide Christian gathering - which are Protestant but not affiliated with the government-controlled Three-Self Church - of more than 50 believers in Zibo city, Shandong. Originally intending to evict the believers, the officers seized three musical instruments and microphones, tore apart religious portraits and smashed other furniture and items used for worship. When the pastor arrived, they forced him to give up 1000 RMB of donation money and took him into detention. The place was sealed off and no longer in use.
On 30 July 2018, local authorities raided a house church in Shapingba District, Chongqing and took away books, properties, and donations boxes. Some believers were also taken away by the officials.

Arrests: On 31 July 2018, over 30 police officers arrested 53 congregation adherents of a house church at a hotel in Jingdezhen city, Jiangxi with the help of an infiltrated undercover agent in the church. Police also confiscated all the money found on believers.

Around 1 August 2018 (beginning of month), government personnel from the Chengyang District Bureau of Education barged into a house church in Qingdao city (Shandong) following a tip-off that it was located opposite a middle school. The personnel ordered that the Christian signage be removed immediatedly and sealed off the grounds before taking the pastor away. This is part of a government crackdown on religious facilities near schools, which is linked to the revised Regulations on Religious Affairs that came into forced on 1 February 2018.

Around 1 August 2018 (beginning of month), a Three-Self Church in Jing'an county (Yichun, Jiangxi) was ''completely altered'' under the state-led ''sinicisation'' campaign against churches. It had put up the national flag and several other ''patriotic'' signboards on its walls. Believers also had to learn to sing the national anthem, make an audio-visual recording of it, and submit it to the prefecture Religious Affairs Bureau.

Around 1 August 2018 (beginning of month), local government sealed off and confiscated the funds of a government-controlled Three-Self Protestant Church in Zhangliyuan Village (Shangqiu, Henan). The church was later converted into a factory and rented out.

Around 1 August 2018 (beginning of month), a Catholic church in Gujun Town (Baoji City, Shaanxi Province) was redecorated into a ''Cultural Activity Centre'' by the authorities. As an alternative to being demolished, religious features of the building including the church's cross was forcibly dismantled. Believers were later informed that the building would serve as a ''community centre'', instead of worship purposes.

Around 1 August 2018 (beginning of month), eight local officials stormed into a church in Gaoyulou Village (Shangqiu, Henan) and dispersed the believers there. The officials tore down the church's cross, portraits, and religious couplets, and confiscated over 10,000 RMB from the church funds.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of China (2012-) People's Armed Police
NOTES: On 2 August 2018, the local government deployed more than 50 special police officers to forcibly remove the cross from a church located in Menghui village, Kangle town (Yichun, Jiangxi), saying that the cross was higher than the national flag.

Around 3 August 2018 (as reported), state schools and other state-owned buildings were converted into ''transformation through education'' camps for Uyghur Muslims in Wusu city, Xinjiang. The facilities were repurposed to solve the problem of overcrowding in older camps.

On 3 August 2018, authorities demolished the studio of artist and political activist Ai Wei Wei in Caochangdi Art Park in Chaoyang district, Beijing. Part of a wider demolition and gentrification campaign in Beijing, Ai was originally notified to have two weeks until he was scheduled to move out, but mechanical diggers began the demolition work much earlier without prior notice.

On 6 August 2018, South Korea and China sent representatives to a bilateral peace talk in Beijing to discuss and work towards the establishment of a peace regime on the Korean Peninsula since the end of the Korean War was formally declared. The two representatives were previously involved in the multilateral six-party talks held intermittently since 2003.

Around 6 August 2018 (as reported), two government facilities - the Thirteenth Division Detention Centre on Beijiao Road and the Vocation Education and Training Centre - in Yizhou district, Hami city, Xinjiang had been converted into ''transformation through education'' camps for Uyghur detainees. The facilities were in operation, but were also about to undergo expansion and further construction.

On 6 August 2018, officials broke into a local temple located in Fengqiao Town (Shangqiu, Henan) and forced the leader to clear the Buddha statues and all the equipment in the temple. The temple was also repainted by the local authorities and became a ''Farmer's Book House''. They also declared that the temple had to be demolished following the CCP's policy.

On 7 August 2018, local authorities forcibly removed the cross of a church belonging to China Patriotic Three-Self Movement located in Xinyu, Jiangxi, saying that ''the cross is higher than the rooftop of the church''.

Arrests: On 7 August 2018, local police arrested over 70 believers of the Church of Almighty God in Chongqing who had been previously arrested in 2014. The arrested believers were held in captivity at a primary school in Baiyang town (Wanzhou, Chongqing), where the authorities forced them to watch anti-Christian videos and say blasphemous words. They were also forced to sign statements renouncing their faith and breaking ties with the Church.

Around 9 August 2018 (as reported), government authorities have demolished seven out of eight mosques in Lianmuqin town, Shanshan county of Xinjiang Uighur Autonomous Region. The remaining mosque is under tight population control and surveillance by law enforcement authorities, creating discomfort for worshippers and deterring them from visiting.

Around 9 August 2018 (as reported), elements of Hui Islamic architecture have been entirely removed by local authorities at the Clear Water Bay market in Tongxin county, Wuzhong, Ningxia. The architectural features removed included domes, minarets and crescent moon symbols.

On 9 August 2018, a Three-Self Church in Zhaishang Village, Gaoji Town (Dengzhou City, Henan Province) was repurposed by the government. It was reported that the director of the church experienced harassment from local authorities.

On 9 August 2018, Xingtan government authorities forcibly confiscated and demolished land belonging to fishermen and villagers in Gaozhan village, Xingtan town of Shunde district (Foshan city), Guangdong taking out all the fish being cultivated and bulldozing into the ponds.

On 9 August 2018, police forces shut down a garment factory in Yuanzhou town, Boluo county of Weizhou city, Guangzhou, whose owner was a man who had been arrested, targeted and monitored since participating in a memorial activity from the previous year commemorating the death of political dissident Liu Xiaobo.
On 10 August 2018, local authorities demolished a Buddhist temple in Lema Town (Shangqiu, Henan).

On 12 August 2018, local officials shut down a Three-Self church in Shibali Town (Shangqiu, Henan). This was part of a broader campaign to shut down 100 out of the 180 Three-Self churches in Yongcheng City.

SOURCE: China Aid; Union of Catholic Asian News
NOTES: On 13 August 2018, more than 170 people sent by the government demolished Qianwang Catholic Church in Jinan Catholic Diocese in Qianwang Village (Jinan, Shandong), destroyed the religious statues inside, and the donation box was missing afterwards. The church was demolished for the reason that it was within the area for the new real estate development plan of the government, and this is the third demolished church in the Jinan Catholic Diocese in 2018. It was reported that the Catholic Diocese had contacted relevant government departments on the demolition and selection of site for the resettlement of the church, but the resettlement plan had yet come to fruition after four years.

On 13 August 2018, a Three-Self church in Chenji Town (Shangqiu, Henan) was shut down by local authorities. Its tables, chairs, and other facilities were dismantled, and the cross was covered with cement.
On 13 August 2018, local officials shut down a church located in Yongcheng County (Shangqiu, Henan) and ordered the believers to remove slogans from the church walls.

On 14 August 2018, six local officials (including officials from the United Front Work Department) raided a Protestant church located in Dengzhou (Nanyang, Henan), and confiscated its properties and removed the cross from the rooftop.

On 14 August 2018, the Bamboo Forest Temple, an ancient Taoist temple, in Huayin county (Weinan, Shaanxi) was demolished by the local authority. The government claimed that the temple violated building codes, but it was among many cases of closing down and demolishing religious venues throughout China.

On 15 August 2018, local party cadre tore down the portraits of Jesus and burnt the Bibles verses hung on the walls of a Three-Self Church located in rural Yucheng Country (Shangqiu, Henan). This was part of a government campaign to shut down churches in Henan, and the believers of the church were told that they would be detained immediately ''if three or more people gathered together.''

On 15 August 2018, the local government tore down the crosses of several local churches in Fenyi County (Xinyu City, Jiangxi Province) and demanded the churches to hang the Chinese national flag, President Xi Jinping's portraits, and campaign posters about the socialist core values. This was a part of the national campaign for the sinicization of Christianity, and a large-scale demolition of crosses across Xinyu City starting from 15 August.

Around 15 August 2018 (as reported), around 100 government authorities and construction workers destroyed over 13,340 square metres of farmland belonging to the Liushutang community in Zengdu District (Suizhou, Hubei). Villagers were not compensated for the expropriated land, but received a fee for the trampled crops.

Around 16 August 2018 (month of), a Three-Self Church in Yongtai Village/Yongtaicun in Lilin Town (Jiyuan, Henan) was converted into a water supply station as part of a state-led province-wide campaign to convert houses of worship into non-religious government-sanctioned activity centres.

Around 16 August 2018 (month of), a 400-year-old Daoist temple in Fengcheng city (Dandong, Liaoning) was shut down by the government. The temple had been rebuilt by a Daoist priest after it was destroyed during the Cultural Revolution.

Around 16 August 2018 (month of), a church in Jinshui District (Zhengzhou City, Henan Province) was shut down by government officials. Two banners were put up at the entrance of the church, stating that a fine of RMB 20,000 to 200,000 would be imposed for illegal religious activities by non-authorised religious groups. The government subsequently sent staff to remove all the furnishings from the meeting venue Around 15 September 2018 (month of).
Around 16 August 2018 (month of), several churches in Luoyang City, Henan Province had their crosses removed by local authorities for disingenuous reasons.

Around 16 August 2018 (month of), the Xiuyan County Ethnic and Religious Affairs Bureau sealed off the ancient Taoist Longwang Temple in Xiuyan Manchu Autonomous County (Liaoning). The act reflected ''an escalation'' in religious persecution by regional CCP authorities.

Around 16 August 2018 (month of), the Jiayuguan city Religious Affairs Bureau sent personnel to erect the national flag and install surveillance cameras at Jiayuguan Mosque Jiayuguan City (Gansu). ''Patriotic'' slogans were also written on its walls and the imam was replaced with one assigned by the government, who, according to the mosque's new regulations, promotes the state's policies before worship.

Around 16 August 2018 (month of), a Three-Self Church in Henan Province was closed down by authorities on the bases that it was ''too close to a school,'' despite it's venue being an approved site. This is part of a government crackdown on religious facilities near schools, which is linked to the revised Regulations on Religious Affairs that came into forced on 1 February 2018.

On 16 August 2018, local authorities shut down a Three-Self church in Shuangqiao Town (Shangqiu, Henan), removing its cross, tearing Jesus portraits, and destroying all material assets inside the Church.

Around 16 August 2018 (month of), a local orphanage ran by Christians in Dehong Prefecture, Yunnan Province was raided by government officials. The officials looted all valuables in the orphanage and dispersed its 80 residents. This was part of a broader campaign to crack down on church-run institutions following the enactment of the New Regulations on Religious Affairs in February 2018.
Around 16 August 2018 (month of), local authorities removed 50 crosses from churches in Shangqiu, Henan, as part of the plan to stop the spread of religion.

Around 16 August 2018 (month of), local officials shut down a Three-Self Church in Yongcheng City (Shangqiu, Henan) because of the church's alleged lack of land permit. The site of the church was transformed into a cultural compound.
On 17 August 2018, local United Front Work Department dismantled the cross of a Three-Self Church in Xijie Community, Chengguan Town (Luoyang, Henan).

On 17 August 2018, a local official who was investigated for donating money to a local Guandi Temple in Yucheng County (Shangqiu, Henan) was forced to personally remove the clay statue, and completely demolish the whole temple later. The official was dismissed from the post despite acting upon the orders from the CCP.

On 19 August 2018, a Three-Self Church in Luyi County (Zhoukou City, Henan Province) was shut down by local authorities, on the grounds that it was located too close to a school. The church was subsequently repurposed into an umbrella factory.

Around 20 August 2018 (as reported), the municipal government of Karamay, Xinjiang had put other construction projects on hold to speed up the building of a detention facility at the Ayi Kule Reservoir, on the western outskirts of Karamay, Xinjiang. With the goal of completing by October, the facility will be constructed as a regular prison with extensive secret facilities. Existing ''transformation through education'' camps have allegedly become overcrowded, and the new facility is planned to accommodate over 10,000 prisoners.

On 20 August 2018, Urban Administrative and Law Enforcement Bureau (UALEB) personnel tried to confiscate the goods of and shut down a store operated by a veteran and his wife in Meilu sub-district of Wuchuan city (Zhenjiang, Guangzhou) on the basis that the goods were blocking the streets. The officials beat up the owners when the latter resisted, and the wife was beaten unconscious. The violent act led to a massive civil commotion later that same night. This incident is linked to tensions between veterans and authorities that intensified in June 2018.
Around 20 August 2018, government authorities shuttered three worship locations belonging to Dao'en Christian church in Xuzhou, Jiangsu.

On 20 August 2018, government authorities ordered the shutdown of a Christian community church in Shenyang, Liaoning. They made allegations of illegal private gathering and financing against the church.

Around 21 August 2018 (between 18-24 August), government authorities shuttered seven worship locations belonging to Zion church, the largest Christian church in Beijing with over 1500 members. Surveillance equipment was installed at the remaining locations.
On 21 August 2018, the local government tore down the cross of a Christian church in Luoyang (Henan). This was part of the national campaign for the sinicization of Christianity.

On 21 August 2018, the local government tore down the cross of Tianentang Christian church in Qibin District (Hebi, Henan). This was part of the national campaign for the sinicization of Christianity.
On 23 August 2018, local authorities started converting the Kazanqi Ethnic Handicraft Production Base located in Yining (Ili, Xinjiang) into a ''transformation through education'' camp.
On 23 August 2018, local authorities removed a cross from a Three-Self Church in Zhengzhou, Henan.

On 23 August 2018, local authorities forcibly removed the cross of a Three-Self Church in Jingyang Town (Luoyang, Henan). The church was also ordered to be shut down, on the grounds that ''the church entrance faced the gate of the Village Committee''.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of China (2012-) People's Armed Police
NOTES: On 24 August 2018, nearly 50 law enforcement and riot police officers showed up at a construction site of a mosque located in Lanzhou, Gansu and spent the next two days to demolish it.

On 24 August 2018, officials from the United Front Work Department and the police raided a Three-Self Church in Tanghe County (Nanyang, Henan) and destroyed its cross, confiscated its belongings, and cleared its facilities.
On 24 August 2018, local authorities forcibly removed the cross from a Three-Self Church located in Madian Town (Luoyang, Henan).
On 24 August 2018, the director of the county's United Front Work Department commanded and supervised the removal of the cross of a newly built Three-Self Church in Zhao Village (Luoyang, Henan).

On 25 August 2018, local authorities sealed off a local Three-Self Gospel Church that belongs to the government-controlled Protestant Patriotic Movement located at Yongcheng County (Shangqiu, Henan) and refurbished it the next day as a poverty assistance workshop.

On 25 August 2018, the Caomiao Church (Three-Self church) in Xinmi county-level city (Zhengzhou City, Henan Province) was forcibly closed and converted into a cultural centre to advance the CCP's aim to weaken the influence of the Christianity. It was also reported that, in August 2018 alone, 56 venues of the government-run Three-Self Church were shut down in Xinmi. Congregations are often pressured to 'donate' their churches to the government. Some of these venues were repurposed in 2019 for other use.

On 25 August 2018, Zhuzhuang Town Chief led 30 law enforcement personnel in looting all the objects from Yi'en church in Tongbai county of Nanyang prefecture, Henan and took six worshippers back to the police station.

Arrests: On 26 August 2018, local police ambushed and sealed off a Taiwanese church located in a community at De'an County (Jiujiang, Jiangxi) and arrested nearly 30 Christians plus 2 Taiwanese church leaders.

On 26 August 2018, the Tongzhaipu Vice Secretary led a group of Electrical Department staff in destroying objects used for worship at a local church at Tongzhaipu town, Tanghe county of Nanyang city, Henan, and made church members take down furniture such as air-conditioning units, tables and chairs.

On 26 August 2018, the Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) issued the newly revised Disciplinary Regulations of the Chinese Communist Party, which set the fundamental guidelines for the conduct of the Party members, specifically with the aim of increasing control and punishment of political cadres and officials for their religious beliefs.
On 26 August 2018, authorities removed crosses from a Three-Self Church in Tiantan Residential District in Jiyuan, Henan.

On 27 August 2018, two crosses of a Three-Self church in Xiaoding Village, Zhanglou County (Nanyang, Henan) were destroyed by people sent by the village cadre. The Chinese characters for the name of the church were also removed from the top of the doorframe, as well as ceramic tiles with a cross pattern on the roof. All furnishings inside the church were destroyed, and the authorities eventually locked up the church. The crackdown on the church took place over two days.

On 27 August 2018, local officials demolished a church of Dingxinzhuang Village (Shangqiu, Henan), destroying the cross and religious properties in the church, ordering the church leader to clear out the rest of the properties, and confiscated 30,000 RMB of church funds.

On 28 August 2018, police officers and local officials raided a Three-Self Church in Zhuzhuang village, Liwan Residential District, Shanyang District (Jiaozuo, Henan), forced the leader of the church to empty out the premises, and put up signs indicating that the place was now a ''Cultural Activity Centre'' and a venue for weddings.

On 28 August 2018, government workers from Yangmiao town, Gaoxin district cleared out a Three-Self church in Niecun/Nie Village in Shanyang District (Jiaozuo, Henan) and put up signs indicating that the place was now an ''Integrated Cultural Service Centre''.
Around 28 August 2018 (week of), local officials shut down a Three-Self church located in Zhutun Village (Shangqiu, Henan) and ordered its locks to be changed and confiscated the property.
On 28 August 2018, the authorities removed the cross of a government-controlled Three-Self church in Xin'an County (Luoyang, Henan).

On 28 August 2018, nearly 50 government officials tore down a Three-Self Protestant Church in Luoyang, Henan for it being a ''illegal construction''. It was reported that the authorities were at the site of the church the day before, but faced strong resistance from believers who guarded the church to prevent it before being demolished.

On 29 August 2018, government employees from the United Work Front Department (UFWD) forced the head of a government-approved Three-Self church in Jiabu Village, Wuzhi County (Jiaozuo, Henan) to hand over the premises to them. The govenrment employees then immediately turned it into a charity centre and Party school after emptying the compound and confiscating computers, electical appliances, and furniture. The cross of the church had also been dismantled a few days before this.

On 29 August 2018, a Three-Self Gospel Church in Humiao Village, Zhecheng County (Shangqiu City, Henan Province) was repurposed into a ''dining site for wedding and funeral council'' on 29 August 2018. Prior to this, in August 2018, the church also had its cross removed, before being shut down by local authorities.

On 30 August 2018, government employees forced the head of a church in Mengmencun/Mengmen village in Wuzhi County (Jiaozuo, Henan) to hand over the keys to the church before clearing out the premises and repurposing it as a ''Charity Institute''.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of China (2012-) People's Armed Police
NOTES: On 30 August 2018, local officials, along with more than 50 public security and special police officers, forcibly dismantled the cross of a Three-Self Church located in Dengfeng City (Zhengzhou, Henan). During the demolition, there was some pushing and shoving between believers and the police, and some believers were taken away by the police.

On 30 August 2018, five government officials from the United Front Work Department raided and dismantled a Three-Self church in Yucheng County (Shangqiu, Henan) and cleared out everything. Afterwards, the place was converted into an electronics company.

On 30 August 2018, local officials broke into a Three-Self Church located in Wangying village, Dengzhou City (Nanyang, Henan) and destroyed paintings and bible verses. Later, tables, chairs, and the cross on the church roof were also removed, with local officials taking away the key of the church as well.

Around 31 August 2018 (end of month), a Guanyin Buddhist temple near the Qinling mountain range in the administration of Weinan City (Shaanxi) was demolished by the local Land Management Bureau, Religious Affairs Bureau, and the law enforcement. The local authorities have target at various religious venues for the purpose of suppressing religious belief.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of China (2012-) People's Armed Police
NOTES: Property destruction: Around 31 August 2018 (end of month), a Buddhist mountain temple in Huyi District (Xi'an, Shaanxi) was demolished by more than 100 armed police dispatched by the local Religious Affairs Bureau, Public Security Bureau, People's Armed Police, and other governmental departments. The temple was destroyed on the basis that it was an ''unprocessed foreign construction''.

Around 31 August 2018 (end of month), local authorities drove out a believer guarding a Three-Self Church in Lingbao (Sanmenxia, Henan), and confiscated its books and property. The church was also converted into an entertainment venue.
Around 31 August 2018 (end of month), local authorities took over two Buddhist temples in Yucheng County (Shangqiu, Henan) and transferred it into a worship place for Mao Zedong.

Around 1 September 2018 (beginning of month), police and over a hundred personnel from the local religious affairs bureau burned the cross of Zhonghua Christian church in Xinxiang (Henan). The church has been persecuted since 2015.
On 1 September 2018, local police arrested at least 6 members of the Church of Almighty God in Nanshu Town (Qingdao, Shandong), raided their homes and confiscated at at least 15,000 USD.
